intro: Fedia uncinata, commonly known as the hooked fedia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and oval-shaped leaves with a slightly waxy texture. Fedia uncinata typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant adaptation and diversity.
